channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Photos: The world welcomes the new year
item.description: As fireworks light the sky and crowds count down together, communities around the globe welcome 2026.
item.content:encoded:
As fireworks light the sky and crowds count down together, communities around the globe welcome 2026.

(Image credit: Izhar Khan)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Greetings from Vienna, where an imperial palace hosts a holiday market for all
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.content:encoded: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Werbeck

item.title: Israel bans dozens of aid groups from Gaza, despite immense needs
item.description: Dozens of international aid groups, like Doctors Without Borders, are now banned from entering Gaza under new rules set by Israel.
item.content:encoded: Dozens of international aid groups, like Doctors Without Borders, are now banned from entering Gaza under new rules set by Israel.
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Why flu cases are surging this season. And, protests erupt in Iran over the economy
item.description: The flu is spreading rapidly across the U.S. this season, and it is expected to get worse. And, protests have erupted across Iran over the country's troubled economy.
item.content:encoded:
The flu is spreading rapidly across the U.S. this season, and it is expected to get worse. And, protests have erupted across Iran over the country's troubled economy.

(Image credit: Quentin Top/Hans Lucas)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Out with the mayo: How Ukrainians reclaim holiday food
item.description: For many people from former Soviet countries, New Year's is a big holiday feast time. A Ukrainian restaurant in Washington gives NPR a taste of what's on the menu.
item.content:encoded:
For many people from former Soviet countries, New Year's is a big holiday feast time. A Ukrainian restaurant in Washington gives NPR a taste of what's on the menu.

(Image credit: Samantha Balaban/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Bangladesh mourns death of first female Prime Minister Khaleda Zia
item.description: Bangladesh is mourning the death of its first female Prime Minister, Khaleda Zia, who died Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: Bangladesh is mourning the death of its first female Prime Minister, Khaleda Zia, who died Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Protesters take to the streets of Iran as the country's economy collapses
item.description: Protests over the economy are sweeping through Iran. The country's currency is plummeting amid concerns Israel will restart its war with Iran, a move President Trump signaled he would approve.
item.content:encoded: Protests over the economy are sweeping through Iran. The country's currency is plummeting amid concerns Israel will restart its war with Iran, a move President Trump signaled he would approve.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: Iranian-American journalist offers an inside look at the protests sweeping Iran
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Iranian-American author and journalist Hooman Majd about the current wave of protests facing Iran and what they mean for its future.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Iranian-American author and journalist Hooman Majd about the current wave of protests facing Iran and what they mean for its future.
item.dc:creator: A Mart√≠nez

item.title: CIA behind strike at Venezuelan dock that Trump claims was used by drug smugglers, AP sources say
item.description: The CIA was behind a drone strike last week at a docking area believed to have been used by Venezuelan drug cartels. That's according to two people familiar with details of the operation.
item.content:encoded:
The CIA was behind a drone strike last week at a docking area believed to have been used by Venezuelan drug cartels. That's according to two people familiar with details of the operation.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: An escalation in Yemen threatens to reignite civil war and widen tensions in the Gulf
item.description: Saudi Arabia bombed Yemen's port city of Mukalla, targeting a shipment of weapons from the United Arab Emirates for separatist forces. The UAE later said it would withdraw its forces from Yemen.
item.content:encoded:
Saudi Arabia bombed Yemen's port city of Mukalla, targeting a shipment of weapons from the United Arab Emirates for separatist forces. The UAE later said it would withdraw its forces from Yemen.

(Image credit: Ted Shaffrey)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
